DOC.HEAD: NEW YORK: month before.
DOC.TEXT: The Dow Jones average of 30 industrials rose 20.90 to 2,753.20, extending its gain for the week to 41.81 points. In 1989 the average climbed 584.63 points, or 26.96 percent, capping off a rise for the decade of 1,914.46 points, or 228.25 percent. Advancing issues outnumbered declines by more than 2 to 1 on the New York Stock Exchange, with 1,072 up, 464 down and 439 unchanged. Big Board volume totaled 145.94 million shares, against 128.03 million in the previous session. The NYSE's composite index gained 1.42 to 195.01.
